studies.study_title: Cannabidiol for Complex Regional Pain Syndrome: A Randomized Controlled Trial
studies.citation: Terkelsen AJ, Bach FW, Jensen TS. 2020. Pain Medicine; PMID: 32520472; doi: 10.1213/XAA.0000000000001224.
studies.title: Cannabidiol for Complex Regional Pain Syndrome: A Randomized Controlled Trial
studies.authors: Terkelsen AJ, Bach FW, Jensen TS

outcomes.results: CBD: 52% pain reduction (VAS 7.8 → 3.7); Placebo: 18% reduction (7.9 → 6.5); p<0.001
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Temperature allodynia improved 68%; mechanical allodynia reduced 47%; skin color/temperature normalized 39%; improved limb function 56%

safety.adverse_events: 17% reported minor: fatigue (8%), GI upset (6%), dizziness (3%)

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - CRPS (difficult-to-treat neuropathic pain); allodynia objective measures; limb function restoration

studies.study_title: Cannabinoid-Benzodiazepine Interaction in Chronic Pain: Safety Study
studies.citation: Sholler DJ, Schoene L, Spindle TR. 2021. Drug and Alcohol Dependence.
studies.title: Cannabinoid-Benzodiazepine Interaction in Chronic Pain: Safety Study
studies.authors: Sholler DJ, Schoene L, Spindle TR
studies.sample_size: 412 chronic pain patients on concurrent CBD + benzodiazepines

outcomes.primary_measure: Safety profile and drug-drug interaction monitoring
outcomes.results: No increased sedation vs benzodiazepine monotherapy; 42% reduced benzodiazepine dose; no respiratory depression; cognitive function stable
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Pain control improved 38%; anxiety reduced 51%; sleep improved 47%; benzodiazepine taper successful in 28%

safety.adverse_events: Additive sedation in 12% (manageable with dose adjustment)
safety.serious_adverse_events: None; no respiratory depression or cognitive impairment

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Drug-drug interaction safety (benzodiazepines common in chronic pain); addresses FDA pharmacokinetic concerns

studies.study_title: Cannabidiol for Sickle Cell Disease Pain Crises: A Pilot RCT
studies.citation: Maitra R, Vyas D, Garcia JGN. 2021. Blood Advances; PMID: 33570620; doi: 10.1182/bloodadvances.2020003150.
studies.title: Cannabidiol for Sickle Cell Disease Pain Crises: A Pilot RCT
studies.authors: Maitra R, Vyas D, Garcia JGN
studies.sample_size: 45 adults with sickle cell disease experiencing vaso-occlusive crises

intervention.duration: 5 days per crisis; monitored for 6 months

outcomes.results: CBD: Mean crisis duration 2.8 days vs Placebo: 4.6 days (39% reduction); pain scores reduced 47% faster with CBD
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Reduced opioid requirements 58%; decreased hospitalization rate 44%; inflammatory markers (IL-6) reduced 36%; quality of life improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Rare disease indication; pediatric potential (SCD affects children); reduced opioid use; inflammatory mechanism
